page.title: 08Quarry Hill Farm, Gt.Ayton
page.content: This farm is Known as Quarry Hill Farm.Its 125 acres are owned by Mr.& Mrs. Whitwell, but farmed in conjunction with the 80 acres of Tree Bridge Farm across the main A172 road to the west. There are 200 ewes on the farm which have had 350 lambs: about average for the area. Mr. Whitwell also fattens calves on cultivated grassland, although he doesn't own them. His Collie dog is only a guard dog and his black Labrador his gun-dog. He has a lot of trouble with vandals from nearby Middlesbrough damaging his fences.He works full-time in the city leaving the farm organisation to his wife. There is a line of old basalt quarries through the farm, now being filled and reclaimed for trees. A water-filled hole is fished by locals.
